alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Marion County through 100 PM EDT... At 1230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Williston Municipal Airport to near The Villages. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ocala, Weirsdale, Anthony, Ocklawaha, Moss Bluff, Silver Springs Shores, Lake Weir, Santos, Ocala Airport and Belleview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion
